basics.name: Tassia Corcoran
basics.label: Shidler Undergraduate
basics.summary: I am studying for a degree in Management Information Systems at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2024.

work.company: University of Hawaii Computer Sciences Department
work.summary: Assisting students with learning computer basics
highlights: Host a weekly open lab where I lead five assistants, I assign them to help any students that attend the lab. I focus on more difficult problems presented and help any assistant who struggles
Create lesson plans that will engage the students with the content while teaching them key skills to succeed
Have a strong understanding of HTML, CSS, UNIX, and Microsoft programs such as Word, Excel, and PowerPoint to be prepared to help teach students and assistants.
Work with programs like Krita and Powerpoint to design posters and graphics for events
Organize and plan large events to encourage students to actively engage with the company
Consistently post and monitor social media tied to the company, then analyze the posts to find what creates the most engagement.

Activities.organization: National Center for Women in Technology
highlights: Running outreach activities with the intention to spread the word about the AiC Community to members on their college campus
Creating and promoting a friendly environment for women, genderqueer, and non-binary people in tech.

awards.title: Deans list
awards.summary: The Dean's List recognizes students with a superior academic record, i.e., a minimum current grade point average of 3.5 for 12 or more credits of academic coursework.
